channel.title: Saml on Partially Attended
channel.description: Recent content in Saml on Partially Attended

item.title: thoughts on GetFTR
item.description: what does it do? By using a single sign-on system (like SAML, or OAuth) a researcher can have their browser remember who they are. Today most access to subscription content is done via IP authentication. A university pays a publisher to access the content that the publisher hosts, and the university sends over a list of the IP ranges that cover the university buildings. Any researcher on campus just gets access.
